laws.summary: Non-compete agreements are enforceable in Texas if reasonable in time, geography, and scope.
laws.full_text: Texas allows non-competes if they: (1) are ancillary to an otherwise enforceable agreement, (2) contain reasonable time/geographic/scope limits, and (3) do not impose greater restraint than necessary. Typically 2 years maximum.
laws.suggestion: Non-compete is acceptable but ensure reasonableness standards are met (2 years max, limited geography)

laws.summary: Texas does not prohibit salary history inquiries.
laws.full_text: Texas has no state law prohibiting employers from asking about salary history. However, best practice is to avoid to promote pay equity.
laws.suggestion: While legal, consider avoiding salary history questions to promote pay equity

laws.summary: Texas requires at least monthly paydays.
laws.full_text: Employers must pay employees at least once per month. Exempt employees can be paid less frequently if agreed. Semi-monthly or bi-weekly is common and acceptable.
laws.suggestion: Ensure pay frequency is stated and at least monthly

laws.summary: Arbitration agreements are generally enforceable in Texas.
laws.full_text: Texas follows Federal Arbitration Act. Mandatory arbitration is acceptable if agreement is not unconscionable. Ensure arbitration clause provides fair procedures and reasonable costs.
laws.suggestion: Arbitration clause is acceptable but ensure fairness standards
